Isn't the timeline weird? ^^; Hera gives birth alone to Hephaestus out of spite because Zeus gives birth to Athena without her (the author used this version). But Hephaestus is the one who cracked his old man's head so his sister can get out. Well, mythologies. | Zeus came to thank Eurynome for raising Hephaestus, but then threaten to tell her husband that his wife has been raising a descendant of Cronus (Cronus and Rhea threw them out of power) and that child is now one of the 12 Olympians. In the end, Eurynome remembered and understand why the rumours says the women whom Zeus have sex with, such as his first wife Metis (Wisdom, whom people thought wouldn't get married) never regretted it in the end, because it felt amazing. BTW, it's her marriage anniversary day.
